com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class RestoreRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.RestoreRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable

    public class RestoreRequest
extends SiperianObjectRequest
    Restores the specified XREF record(s) in the Hub. Restore changes the state of records from Deleted to Active. If an attempt is made to restore an Active or Pending record, an error is returned. After an XREF record is restored, the state of the base object record will be active.

    Required Parameters:

    • SiperianObjectUid - Specifies the base object or package that contains the record to restore. If this object is a base object, it must be state management enabled. If this object is a package, it must be based on a base object that has state management enabled and must be put-enabled.
    • XrefKeys - represents the records to restore in the package specified using setSiperianObjectUid(). Each XrefKey entry selects one XREF record to restore.

    Usage Example:

    The following example restores the XREF record with sourceKey=1234 and system=CRM from the package CUSTOMER_UPDATE. If the XREF record is pending or active, an error will be returned. If the XREF record is deleted, it will be made active.

    RestoreRequest request = new RestoreRequest();
    XrefKey xrefKey = new XrefKey();
    xrefKey.setSourceKey("1234");
    xrefKey.setSystemName("CRM");
    ArrayList xrefKeys = new ArrayList();
    xrefKeys.add(xrefKey);
    request.setXrefKeys(xrefKeys); // Required
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("PACKAGE.CUSTOMER_UPDATE"); //Required

    RestoreResponse response = (RestoreResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    See Also:
    RestoreResponse, XrefKey, XrefResult, SiperianClient.process(SiperianRequest), Serialized Form

    API Pair: RestoreResponse

    API Group: State Management
